website_summaries.verdict: The Panasonic Lumix DMC-ZS50 is a pocket-friendly camera with a 30x zoom lens, Raw shooting support, and an EVF. It costs a little bit more than competing models, but still manages to earn Editors' Choice honors.

customer_reviews.title: It is a brilliant camera
customer_reviews.text: I use the camera for all types of photography, from Macro (as minute as raindrops on flowers), to using the full zoom for birds and butterflies, fast shutter speed for animals, correct white balance for landscape shots and seascapes and in all lighting conditions from bright sunlight to low light night-time shots. I photo-merge exposures to capture the night sky with the full moon (with all its craters) and also the beautiful cloud patterns in the sky around the moon. I have yet to find a situation that the camera cannot cope with!! And it fits in my pocket!!
customer_reviews.author: A keen amateur photographer

customer_reviews.title: Excellent value being an older model
customer_reviews.text: An amazingly good camera with a host of useful features too many to comment on here. It is better in low light conditions than my previous TZxx cameras and is quick to be ready after switch on. I believe it would be equally suitable for beginners with its excellent auto settings and for more experienced photographers with its wide range of advanced manual options and RAW option. It is now at a very good price being an older model but it still takes very good photos. Why pay £100's more for the same quality images?
customer_reviews.author: Wookeyhole

customer_reviews.title: an idiot proof "point and shoot"
customer_reviews.text: I am generally dreadful at taking pictures, especially as I tend to stick with budget smart phones with not the greatest cameras. This device has already given me so many stunning pictures of my children and family for which I am so grateful. I was looking for an idiot proof "point and shoot" and this has totally fit the bill. Switch it to Auto and fire away. I also love the WiFI component, connect and grab your pictures over the air, which Android then backs right up onto your cloud storage.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. B. K. Rosenthal

customer_reviews.title: Arrived quickly and seems a good camera although I have not yet had much chance ...
customer_reviews.text: Arrived quickly and seems a good camera although I have not yet had much chance to try out. My only gripe is why would Panasonic not supply a charger? Having to charge in camera is a pain and I had to buy a Blumax charger. I need to have a spare battery when out shooting as they have a habit of running out at important moments..
customer_reviews.author: Ms. A. M. Jenkins

customer_reviews.title: Some praise for an outstanding camera
customer_reviews.text: I have owned many cameras including several "old fashioned" and digital reflexes. This one equals or surpasses them all for performance. It is just a bit too big for patch pockets on trousers. It is truly a multi-function camera but not too hard to exploit fully. One of my "Never regretted" purchases. The "Waterproof, anti shock, double protection hard case for Panasonic Lumix....." by BV and Jo, at at a modest £10 or thereabouts, suits it very well. Available though Amazon of course.
customer_reviews.author: Peter

customer_reviews.title: great anywhere camera. Photo taken indoors 19 Mar 2016, just before Eng/Fra rugby.
customer_reviews.text: Plenty of detail reviews elsewhere. I have a DSLR usually fitted with a 300mm prime, so needed something for wider angles and of course something for fit in the pocket carry everywhere. What made me buy this particular model was: 1. electronic viewfinder - (good in daylight) 2. no GPS - (battery saver) 3. wifi - (easy to transfer to social media) 4. NFC - (easy to pair if you get the tapping correct) Decent zoom too.
customer_reviews.author: PCop

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use and compact
customer_reviews.text: I have previously had 2 Panasonic Lumix digital camera and found that it was very easy to use, compact and fits into your pocket.But most important, takes very good pictures. This one is a bit more up market with more features but still compact. It goes together with my Canon DSLR 550.
customer_reviews.author: grandad

customer_reviews.title: Superb camera with results equal to an SLR
customer_reviews.text: Amazing and comprehensive all round quality camera. It has more features than I've seen on a compact camera. The automatic response electronic viewfinder is great thank goodness for it on sunny days when screen can't be seen. The video quality is professional quality and still pictures can be taken whilst doing a video. The position of the flash is not too good as it's easy to cover with be finger. With Leica lens can't go wrong, it feels well made and sturdy, one of the better cameras I've had and a great price, well pleased.
customer_reviews.author: Lord Christopher Isherwood

customer_reviews.title: ... camera having owned a LUMIX before and wanting a better zoom with out having to carry all the lenses ...
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this compact camera having owned a LUMIX before and wanting a better zoom with out having to carry all the lenses I have for my SLR. I was going on a safari and was weight restricted so this was ideal. The zoom on it is amazing and I have some fabulous shots. My criticism is that the writing came off the button on the back possibly due to the heat and greasy fingers however I do not think this is good enough. Panasonic were great and it has been repaired under warranty so now I will be more careful. All in all a fabulous camera that I a, still finding my way around all it can do.
customer_reviews.author: Jogger

customer_reviews.title: Takes a brilliant picture and the wifi function is helpful if you ...
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my partner and she loves it. So much so that her bridge SLR rarely makes an appearance anymore when we go out. Takes a brilliant picture and the wifi function is helpful if you are out and find yourself without cable and accessories but want to get the photos to a phone or mobile device.
customer_reviews.author: Mark Shepherd

customer_reviews.title: Great holiday camera, but for the dreadful WiFi link.
customer_reviews.text: Great holiday camera, light, compact, easy to use, and the zoom is way better than I was expecting. Shame there's no lens cap. That would be nice to keep the dust out. I'll have to look for some sort of poly cap from the food bin! Like all Lumix, the WiFi is horrible to set up and use. It is slightly better than in the past but still very difficult to set up. I just take the memory card out to get my pictures. And finally, the charging cable is non standard so you need to take the lead with you on holiday rather simply using yours or someone else's standard phone lead.
customer_reviews.author: gethinb

customer_reviews.title: Disappointing results  :-(
customer_reviews.text: I was excited reading all the reviews of this camera but in practice the camera for me performed badly. I holidayed in Croatia and the camera did not perform very well in bright sunlight or in low levels. The majority of my photos turned out dull and grey. The auto flash performed poorly too with too many blurred or dark images. It's probably me but setting up the wi-fi seems awkward too. I was hoping to transfer directly to my PC over the network but you have to set it up via you mobile, again not as I imagined! Overall, for me the camera is disappointing.
customer_reviews.author: Vince

customer_reviews.title: My fourth TZ
customer_reviews.text: A good deal more complicated than previous TZ cameras but can still be used for point and shoot, although a cheaper camera would also do that. A diligent study of the lengthy downloaded manual is needed for sophisticated use and shows what a versatile camera it is. Good results.
customer_reviews.author: Ray Cheesman

customer_reviews.title: Best compact camera I’ve ever bought.
customer_reviews.text: Great little camera. Ideal for carrying around in a pocket for quickly taking photos when your out and about. The best feature of this small camera is that it has an eye piece for composing your photo as well as the screen. Makes taking pictures out doors in bright conditions easy as you can see exactly what your shooting. Love it. Plus picture quality is superb & it’s very simple & intuitive to use. Best compact camera I’ve ever bought.
customer_reviews.author: P. heyes

customer_reviews.title: A beatiful little travel zoom.
customer_reviews.text: I bought a black one for my wife originally, & she loves hers. Now I have bought the silver version for my daughter. So far so good. Both like the ability to take pictures without flash in most conditions, and the ease of use in automatic mode. The pictures taken in typical conditions look as good as my FZ1000 set to automatic. The latter excels in low light as it uses a much bigger sensor. The TZ70 is much smaller and lighter and can be slipped into a handbag.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great Camera, worth the money.
customer_reviews.text: It may not be ultra hi definition or have a touchscreen but this is a really capable camera, on full auto it does a great job and looks really snazzy. I will need to learn alot to use it's full potential!
customer_reviews.author: Ms. Pj Hawcroft

customer_reviews.title: ... of the camera and especially the Zoom to be excellent. Comparing pictures with other people who had much ...
customer_reviews.text: Just back from a month's Safari in Namibia and found the performance of the camera and especially the Zoom to be excellent. Comparing pictures with other people who had much more expensive (normally Canon) SLR cameras, there was no discernible difference in the quality of the photos. Although the build quality is good, it's a shame the actual camera body is rather plasticky and cheap feeling. One complaint about Panasonic cameras is - why so many different battery sizes? Over the years I've had a TZ1, TZ10 and now TZ70 and all the batteries are different. I highly recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: A. Etherington

customer_reviews.title: Great camera if used within it's limits
customer_reviews.text: Handy camera for traveling, with plenty of manual settings to play with. The viewfinder is brilliant on a camera of this size.
customer_reviews.author: AK

customer_reviews.title: Amazing quality from something so small and relatively inexpensive.
customer_reviews.text: This camera is genuinely small enough to fit in your pocket yet it is able to capture fantastic images (see attached examples). The Leica lens is first class and remarkable for a camera at this price point. As someone relatively new to serious digital photography the interface is also much easier to get the hang of than others I have owned; the scrolling explanatory footnote for each function helps a lot here. Finally, the good quality electonic viewfinder is a boon when shooting outdoors in bright conditions as it is much easier to compose and review shots using this than the main screen. So, all in all, a billiant little camera - highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Hugh Tooby

customer_reviews.title: All great, until the zoom jams. And it will.
customer_reviews.text: I liked this camera a lot. It takes great pictures, it's lightweight and portable and is packed with features and is a great step up from a smartphone camera. The problem is that the zoom mechanism just isn't robust enough. Eventually it will start having problems if the tiniest bit of grit or water gets in the mechanism. After less than a year of use the zoom on mine has totally jammed up rendering it useless. And a year of use for a camera just isn't enough. Find something more robust, or at least don't travel with it.
customer_reviews.author: bradlay e mayhew

customer_reviews.title: Superb accompaniment to the Leica.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to complement my Leica D-Lux 4. I mainly do landscapes/wide angles, so the Leica is perfect for that, but wanted a capable zoom for times when I needed more focal length. Here I have 24-720mm in 35mm terms; the Leica has 24-60mm. So rather than cart heavy film cameras and lenses up the mountains, I can now do it all with 2 digital cameras. Before I had a Professional Nikon DSLR and Pro f2.8 lenses, and the weight was stupid. I get brilliant results with the Leica, and I will with the Panasonic and its Leica vario-elmar lens.
customer_reviews.author: Apophis

customer_reviews.title: A lot of camera in a small frame.
customer_reviews.text: I love this camera. It does more things than I know how to use, produces fantastic quality pictures, takes fantastic macro shots, and the image stabilization is top notch. Many of the pictures I take on my phone are marred by my hands shaking, but this camera seems to take solid pictures no matter what. And to have so much functionality in such a small package is really handy.
customer_reviews.author: velvettank

customer_reviews.title: Good camera no cashback
customer_reviews.text: The camera is fine as a pocket model with good zoom. i was disappointed to find that despite an advertised post purchase £50 cash back offer,Panasonic told me it was not applicable to my purchase through Amazon. I complained to Amazon and received no reply. Clearly I must read the Panasonic material with minute care in future. If there should be a future purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Clive

customer_reviews.title: Fabulous little camera with amazing zoom
customer_reviews.text: This camera does everything I want and is capable of doing all sorts of other things that I haven't found out about yet. I would have given it 5 stars if it wasn't for the fact that it developed a fault after only about eight months. But it still deserves 4 stars because the repair was carried out very quickly when I raised it through Amazon with the vendor, LetsGO Digital. Excellent service.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. J. D. Thomas

customer_reviews.title: Good Lens
customer_reviews.text: It was impossible to register this camera with Panasonic for warranty. I suspect that this is because it appears to be obsolete stock. This was not mentioned in your web site at the time of purchase. In my view it should most certainly be so stated as it is of material importance. JGB
customer_reviews.author: Gordon

customer_reviews.title: Good camera but poor GPS tagging
customer_reviews.text: The main feature I was looking for was the ability to tag pictures with GPS data, so I can always look back and remember exactly where I was when the picture was taken. I thought this feature was built-in, but it actually needs a phone to be constantly paired by Bluetooth. The annoying thing was that every time you turned the camera on you had to re-establish the connection. (Plus you drained the battery on the phone). The accompanying app to allow remote control was very poor and buggy. The photos themselves were good and the zoom was great.
customer_reviews.author: philch1

customer_reviews.title: Do not buy with out a year waranty
customer_reviews.text: This camera started to have problems early on, the zoom stopped working and could not focus . Have asked for support but as yet have not received any. When they work there superb but the zoom always goes first. Sounds like a traction engine.
customer_reviews.author: Emily

customer_reviews.title: Avoid it like the plague
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for £182 recently from Amazon. .The supplied DVD will not load in either of my PCs (Win 7 and Win 10). There are no support pages for this camera by Panasonic UK. It is not user-friendly to use. Downloading to PC currently entails me removing the memory card from the camera. Zero support from Panasonic. Don't buy.
customer_reviews.author: SolihullRog

customer_reviews.title: As Always from Panasonic a great little camera!
customer_reviews.text: The camera as I always find with Panasonic products, is great quality and good value for money. It is slightly larger and heavier than my previous and similar Panasonic camera, but the model I have had for some 10 years is no longer available so I decided on this one, and I am delighted with it. Would recommend it for anyone who want a small and easy to use camera, especially for holiday and general photo's. Quality of photos are great. As usual with Panasonic products - just good quality at a good price - hard to beat!
customer_reviews.author: James Brown

customer_reviews.title: Very happy with first results.
customer_reviews.text: Very happy with this purchase. Replaces a Fufifine F500 which I had for many years, which sadly my husband lost recently. Very impressed with sturdy feel of camera and ease of setting up. Early days yet but very pleased with the high quality of the first few pictures I have taken, especially the sharpness and colours of the first Spring flowers. Still discovering how certain things work will keep on experimenting. Looking forward to snapping away for a long time to come.
customer_reviews.author: Mrs. S. Cronin

customer_reviews.title: Perfect
customer_reviews.text: I bought thus to replace an earlier model. This one is slightly larger but the photos are perfect. It's just as easy to use and does it all for you. Wouldn't buy any other make
customer_reviews.author: Wing

customer_reviews.title: Great travel camera
customer_reviews.text: This is my second camera of this type. My old camera was almost the same, however this one automatically switches to viewfinder when you put your eye to the viewfinder. There is a nice smooth zoom lens and the image stabilisation makes it easy to take photos without flash. There are plenty of settings that can be used or fully manual. It is as good as a DSLR (in my opinion) but without the bulkiness and need to change lenses.
customer_reviews.author: KJWelsh

customer_reviews.title: A superb pocket camera
customer_reviews.text: A superb pocket camera that does all I want from a camera. Not a bad price & easy to use. I'm one of those people who never reads instructions until I have a problem. So when this camera arrived, I simply charged it, put my card in, had a fiddle with the easy to use buttons & was up & running in no time at all. I'm no Daivd Bailey, but the pictures are far better than I took with my previous camera.
customer_reviews.author: MandM

customer_reviews.title: More than I expected from a compact camera
customer_reviews.text: Nothing to dislike. Bought this to take with me on walks and as I have a decent Fuji camera, never expected too much from a compact camera. I just love it. The zoom is more than I ever could have hoped, crisp, clear images and stabilisation for the shakes when up close or at great distance. Fits perfectly in a pocket or palm or in my little cross body case. A really good buy.
customer_reviews.author: Peanut_Brittle

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to replace aTZ 60 which I had Broken. It is ,if possible even better. I use it as a video camera for trains and Ships. The Telephoto is excellent for Big ships a distance of 5 or 6 miles rounding a channel marker bouy then up to my house. I love it.
customer_reviews.author: Fat Richard

customer_reviews.title: Really nice little camera
customer_reviews.text: If you need an ultra compact, this is a great choice - insane zoom range, decent screen and good (for a compact) quality pictures, manual controls for when you need them but smart auto for point and click.
customer_reviews.author: Dave

customer_reviews.title: so far so good
customer_reviews.text: We purchased this as we required a camera for shooting images for my wife's dyslexia teaching workbooks. Pretty good so far not got my head round the application, so I've transferred these with the SD card/reader. Yup we like it! BC
customer_reviews.author: Ben Cowell

customer_reviews.title: easy to navigate with control dial
customer_reviews.text: Bought to replace a Canon G9X which I never got on with since its features were burried in touch menues. Plus Points As a previous Lumix user I find that the control dial is easier and faster to use. Better zoom. Fewer but larger pixels. (all pixels are not born equal) Minus Points Battery has to be charged in the camera. I cannot find a way to modify the flash exposure.
customer_reviews.author: film user

customer_reviews.title: Good picture quality
customer_reviews.text: Takes a good image but menus are not at all intuitive compared to others and slow to navigate through. A very good point and shoot with handy zoom that has some issues ie it can be hit or miss as to where it stops . Handy holiday camera but can’t complete with a DSLR for versatility.
customer_reviews.author: Scottswahay

customer_reviews.title: What a great little camera - Raw got it
customer_reviews.text: What a great little camera - Raw got it, Super picture quality got it, Exposure compensation got it, long exposures got it, high ISO got it,responsive zoom got it. I did order a 2nd battery though, best not get caught short !! Nice work Panasonic
customer_reviews.author: Steve Webb

customer_reviews.title: Excellent camera, flash in wrong place
customer_reviews.text: Spoiled by the flash just where your finger wants to hold the camera. Even when you consciously move your finger it casts a shadow which spoils most flash photos. Viewfinder excellent but they need to sort the flash.
customer_reviews.author: david

customer_reviews.title: Great little Camera - Point and Click
customer_reviews.text: Previously had a TZ18 Lumix which needed replacing due to damage by child. This is perfect for point and click which is what I needed with 3 young children. Mainly taken with the Intelligent Auto - Images are very clear, in bright sunlight, dark rooms. Some of the other modes have been tested and work well. But with 3 young children no time to select! Perfect for my growing family and hope to have many photos to treasure as they grow with this camera.

customer_reviews.title: Excellent service
customer_reviews.text: I was concerned about ordering a camera on line and paying out a lot of money but my concerns were unfounded as this seller and camera was mire than I could have wished for . The camera description was everything as stated and found the camera to be as new with no blemishes whatsoever . It was like it had never been used . It arrived within a few days of ordering and can only say that I am so happy with this camera and the seller that would not hesitate in using them again.
customer_reviews.author: ritareader

customer_reviews.title: A Fantastic Camera
customer_reviews.text: I bought this primarily for travelling to shove into a jacket pocket when a DSLR is simply too big for comfort. Not only that but it is an outstanding camera in its own right. It can happily be left on Aperture priority all day long.
customer_reviews.author: Big John

customer_reviews.title: Great Travel Camera
customer_reviews.text: A great little travel camera. Takes great stills, shoots good quality video, and even has a (limited version) ability to produce in camera short time lapses.
customer_reviews.author: Colin Hunt

customer_reviews.title: It feels real
customer_reviews.text: I was recommended this camera and the reviews are so positive. I was going to get a later model but since I am just a simple snapper I realised I didn't need any more sophistication. There's a lot to learn but it also works fine on automatic.
customer_reviews.author: vbp

customer_reviews.title: Dodgy Lens Assembly
customer_reviews.text: The camera itself is good; it takes good pictures and is easy to use. Having a proper viewfinder is good. However, I have had two of them, and they have both failed in the same way, the mechanism that moves the lens assembly has failed. The first one was less than a year old; the second just under three years old. I won't buy another the same to replace it. Also, if you are buying a Panasonic camera, BEWARE of their warranty policy. I bought the first one from a Marketplace seller, and Panasonic refused to honour the warranty because they aren't an "authorised seller". However, to be fair, Amazon.co.uk offered me a replacement.
customer_reviews.author: dave36200

customer_reviews.title: Great beginners camera
customer_reviews.text: Great little camera for someone like me that has no clue how to use one. Only fault is that there is no written manual and at my time of life I have to read something several times before it sinks in. One day I will venture from the auto settings but I am more than happy with results so far
customer_reviews.author: AnnW

customer_reviews.title: Handy little camera
customer_reviews.text: This handy sized camera does everything my much larger and heavier bridge camera does. Good zoom, although some lack of detail when used on full zoom. It produced some really good shots in a dimly lit aquarium. Very pleased so far
customer_reviews.author: Julianne

customer_reviews.title: Good camera but stay away from the beach
customer_reviews.text: This is the third of these I've bought. I damaged the first one but the second and third have both had problems with the lens cover. In the case of the third one it seems to have been sand blown in whilst I was on a beach (no, I didn't put the camera on the sand).
customer_reviews.author: Peter Baird

customer_reviews.title: No product support.
customer_reviews.text: Broke within a year and Panasonic refusing to repair as Amazon not a recommended seller.
customer_reviews.author: shirley whatley

customer_reviews.title: Does the job
customer_reviews.text: Very good pictures, not quite as good as my SLR but not far off. Easy to carry in hand and put in my pocket. And so easy to use. An amazing telephoto. Works well in poor light with the flash switched off. But cameras are used to take pictures and this does the job very well indeed.
customer_reviews.author: REG

customer_reviews.title: Lovely compact camera
customer_reviews.text: I still have to take a few more photos to get the hang of it. But - and maybe this is just me - the screen seems to be awfully cluttered with symbols denoting technical features being used on the camera. Still, so far it seems to do the job.
customer_reviews.author: Brian Luke Oswald

customer_reviews.title: Not up to expectations
customer_reviews.text: Made this purchase with a view to replacing a DSLR that was staring to get a bit on the heavy side. Having read reviews I thought this would fit the bil but sadly the picture quality was not good so the camera was returned.
customer_reviews.author: Ian Rose

customer_reviews.title: Excellent value and pictures
customer_reviews.text: All delivered early Best price around ... £10 off for silver topped version Some very useful features ...beyond the 'auto' mode So far taking great pictures ..despite dropping it once
customer_reviews.author: Michael Peterson

customer_reviews.title: the excellent Lumix TZ70
customer_reviews.text: This is my second tz70. I broke the last one. 😭 I love this camera, the zoom is phenominal, the pictures are lovely and clear and its easy to use. You can get complicated with manuel focus etc so its a good all rounder.
customer_reviews.author: Sue R

customer_reviews.title: Feature laden long zoom compact camera with EVF. More good points than bad.
customer_reviews.text: This camera is feature laden with a fantastic zoom and an, essential to me, EVF. I think the image processing sometimes produces a slightly blurred look if you crop heavily or zoom in hence only 4 stars for image quality, I'm comparing to my previous Lumix bridge type camera. It is slightly larger than I expected and only just passes the jacket top pocket test. Looks really nice but there is a hint of a plasticky feel. I bought this recently with voucher for £175 and for that price I'm very pleased, I would not have thought it good value at the initial price when it first came out around £350.
customer_reviews.author: Mrs M Woollard

customer_reviews.title: Outstanding
customer_reviews.text: An excellent camera that has produced good photos. The zoom is exceptional. The number of features are almost absurd, and many duplicate those that can be found in the computer software used after the photos are downloaded.
customer_reviews.author: Clutters

customer_reviews.title: Excellent small camera that produces very good images.
customer_reviews.text: 30x optical zoom really first class. I am considering buying separate charger and spare battery as the battery can only be charged when in the camera. This is the only negative point about this camera which should not be considered a valid reason to not buy this item as it is only relevant for prolonged usage when a charging point is not available.
customer_reviews.author: Paul Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Excellent buy
customer_reviews.text: A cracking little camera for a budding photographer. Simple and compact, the picture quality is excellent. Battery not as good as I'd like but I carry extra battery with me. Fully charged. Can't fault it.
customer_reviews.author: Heather Tomlinson

customer_reviews.title: Handy Camera
customer_reviews.text: I'm not an experienced photographer but I wanted something a wee step up from my present ( point and shoot ) This is it, A better resolution etc. a bit bigger but still handy to carry about. Happy me.
customer_reviews.author: Jimmy the one

customer_reviews.title: All rounder
customer_reviews.text: The best compact camera ive ever owned, I sold my old Nikon 3200 SLR, and put the proceeds towards the Lumix DMC-TZ70EB-K, and im very happy that i did. Its great for a variety of shots, whether your an expert or a novice you will get great results.
customer_reviews.author: maxhomebits

customer_reviews.title: Top Camera
customer_reviews.text: Last year I bought an expensive digital camera with a free telephoto lens but it is an awkward thing too use, so as I already have three Lumix cameras in my collection I bought this for my wife as expected she loves it and why not Lumix are the best small to medium size digital cameras you can buy no such thing as a bad exposure. A truly solid well built camera superb Leica lens.
customer_reviews.author: Bluesuede

customer_reviews.title: very easy to use in point and shoot mode
customer_reviews.text: Really like this camera. Has an eye level view finder as well as the screen. It also has a zoom. It is very light as well as being easy to use. I highly recommend this camera.
customer_reviews.author: alamedajo

customer_reviews.title: Great buy!
customer_reviews.text: Great little camera. I bought this as I was fed up with the quality of my phone camera. Best thing I could have done. V easy to use, takes a bit of time to get used to the various settings but straight forward enough. WiFi setup was a doddle and the 12mp are quality. Can’t wait to take on my hols to Cuba.
customer_reviews.author: E2877

customer_reviews.title: Only one fault.
customer_reviews.text: When taking a photo the right index finger partly covers the flash window. A fault the designers will correct in future models. Otherwise very pleased with camera results. Why pay more.
customer_reviews.author: Mary Smith

customer_reviews.title: It has a viewfinder
customer_reviews.text: This is a great camera.It might be a few years old but includes feature to take pictures through glass.Great if you are on a coach or train so a good camera for holidays.Later versions do not include that feature Bargain if you can find it for less than £200.
customer_reviews.author: Norman Taylor

customer_reviews.title: Exceptionally pleased
customer_reviews.text: Exceptionally pleased with this upgrade to my Lumix TZ40. The viewfinder was the reason for the new purchase and i am very, very pleased. The addition of the control ring makes so much more sense. I am not at all worried that there is no touch screen on this model, for although you can switch it off it always seemed to come on and be a nuisance. My daughter is now very pleased with the hand-me down!
customer_reviews.author: Isabel

customer_reviews.title: which I loved and lost
customer_reviews.text: I had a tz35, which I loved and lost, so I was confident that this would be a good camera. It is a very good camera and at this price would be hard to beat. I bought it as my slr set up is too big for carrying up mountains and I wanted a bit more control than my phone camera. Tz70 fulfils this role perfectly (so far)
customer_reviews.author: e p woolsey

customer_reviews.title: Happy wife  great life
customer_reviews.text: Required camera for New Year in dark setting. Gift for my wife. 1. Easy to set up and use. 2.Zoom is better that most phones. 3.Small fits into wife's clutch bag 4. Handled poor light levels. 5.Downloads through Wifi to her I pad once we got home. DAYS OF THE CAMERA STILL AROUND FOR A WHILE
customer_reviews.author: Ian Wheatley

customer_reviews.title: A very good line of cameras
customer_reviews.text: I formerly had a TZ60 one and loved it. This one promises to retain the good features of its former "sister" together with some other ones that will enhance its operation. So far, I firstly checked that everuthing was in order and the basic functioning responds. Now it is time to start with its new enhancements.
customer_reviews.author: Ana Z

customer_reviews.title: Intermittent Fault
customer_reviews.text: Intermittent fault and screen goes blank particularly when you alter the orientation sideways. The sutter also jams.
customer_reviews.author: Chessmachine

customer_reviews.title: It produces great photos for such a small camera
customer_reviews.text: It produces great photos for such a small camera. newer ones may be better but while this model is available if i need another one i'll buy this one again
customer_reviews.author: david mitchell

customer_reviews.title: Ideal camera, with many on the market choose the right one.
customer_reviews.text: Are very pleased with the LUMIX camera, just returned from a three week holiday in India so took many photos, the zooo was very good especially on the tiger safaris, also with sightseeing.
customer_reviews.author: Leslie Searle

customer_reviews.title: Great little compact camera
customer_reviews.text: Bought to take out and about with me. Small and compact, great zoom for a small camera. Lightweight and easy to put in a pocket if you need to. Still finding out all it can do!
customer_reviews.author: Shropshire_lass

customer_reviews.title: nice camera.
customer_reviews.text: Really good camera for taking away when you are going on holiday or just for using every day.
customer_reviews.author: bigbird

customer_reviews.title: Superb automatic camera with
customer_reviews.text: Superb quality pictures. Birthday present for my wife and she absolutely loves it. Still trying out the various settings and functions to find the most efficient way of using it but that doesn't matter - it works flawlessly (and automatically) straight out of the box.
customer_reviews.author: T.J.Milburn

customer_reviews.title: Idiot Proof
customer_reviews.text: Brilliant camera. Takes superb, richly coloured pictures. Intelligent Auto setting is great for the beginner and experienced photographer alike... and there's plenty of scope to be creative using manual modes etc. All this in a camera you can slip in your pocket. :)
customer_reviews.author: Mr. K

customer_reviews.title: Pocketable lightweight very capable camera.
customer_reviews.text: For the price asked it is a great super zoom, also very pocketable and very easy to use.
customer_reviews.author: The South Lincs Geoff Brown

customer_reviews.title: Good compact LUMIX
customer_reviews.text: Nice compact point & click. The down-sides are: a) to easy covering flash and so hiding it; and b) difficult to adjust viewfinder focus. I'm getting used to those. I wish Panasonic used a standard USB cable rather than a bespoke one.
customer_reviews.author: Craig A

customer_reviews.title: Very nice little gadget indeed
customer_reviews.text: Lovely camera. Feels heavy but that's just because of the high-end lens: it's very compact. We're still working through learning and using all its many features but so far we are having a wonderful time with it. I'd say a fair price to pay for a compact wildlife camera.
customer_reviews.author: RVH

customer_reviews.title: Very pleased!
customer_reviews.text: I was pleasantly surprised by the image quality and facilities the camera offers. For me it's a 'one stop shop' and an ideal companion for trips away. Do I really need my expensive SLR?
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Impressive little camera
customer_reviews.text: Very small and light does everything that I could want and lots more, I'm impressed by the ability to control it remotely from my phone.The 30 times zoom lens is impressive. The photos that I have taken so far in bright and low light appear to be very good.
customer_reviews.author: Mr Derek A Morley

customer_reviews.title: Compact and easy to use
customer_reviews.text: Great little camera with decent zoom. Always take it with me when I go for a walk compact enough to go in my pocket
customer_reviews.author: Mrs price

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: I'm a fan of Panasonic Digital cameras and find that this one meets all my requirements.
customer_reviews.author: Roy Wright

customer_reviews.title: Great!
customer_reviews.text: I have only had time to give this camera a quick try but it seems to be amazing! The zoom is out of this world! My 3rd Lumix!
customer_reviews.author: P. Martin

customer_reviews.title: Panasonic camera. Amazing what it does and clarity of pictures excellent video
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic camera fantastic price. Wi-Fi connection to. Leica lens you can't go wrong.
customer_reviews.author: Jazzy P

customer_reviews.title: Takes beautiful pics - its been a real pleasure to me ...
customer_reviews.text: Takes beautiful pics - its been a real pleasure to me both on holiday and just carrying it around as I go about my business.Well worth its price tag!
customer_reviews.author: Esther G

customer_reviews.title: Panasonic camera
customer_reviews.text: Excellent camera with view finder no more worrying about the sun blocking out screen
customer_reviews.author: David Slator

customer_reviews.title: Great little camera
customer_reviews.text: Bought on behalf of my brother who is very impressed with the camera. Excellent picture quality. Easy to use on simple programme but needs time to fathom out all the more complicated functions. Comes with manual on disc for help with this.
customer_reviews.author: Wendy M

customer_reviews.title: Very responsive camera
customer_reviews.text: Much better than earlier Panasonic models, but then again Lumix are the best in this category.
customer_reviews.author: Joe Soap

customer_reviews.title: Love it. It was marked up as reconditioned
customer_reviews.text: Love it. It was marked up as reconditioned, but looked brand new. It's just small enough to carry in my pocket and takes really good photos. For a compact camera, the telescopic lenses is great. Of solid construction and easy to use, this camera is a holiday must.
customer_reviews.author: Marty

customer_reviews.title: Great Camera
customer_reviews.text: This was a present for a family member and they love it.
customer_reviews.author: mr antony monticelli

customer_reviews.title: Quality Lens
customer_reviews.text: Compact. Lots of options in settings. Silver and Black looks like a real camera...I'm still analogue at heart!
customer_reviews.author: Alan McCullough

customer_reviews.title: Good small camera.
customer_reviews.text: Appears to work well, great zoom. Great for my work.
customer_reviews.author: Carlos30

customer_reviews.title: Just trying out new camera
customer_reviews.text: I am just getting used to using this camera plenty of functions for the price especially like the electronic viewfinder. The zoom and video function are also very good.
customer_reviews.author: ANDREW S.

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic camera which I am thoroughly enjoying using
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic camera which I am thoroughly enjoying using. Does everything and more that I could ask for. I have been a fan of the TZ series of cameras for years having had a TZ10, TZ30, TZ40, TZ60 and now the TZ70. Don't see to much change between the TZ60 and TZ70, but both are ideal travel cameras.
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth Oliver

customer_reviews.title: This camera is ace!
customer_reviews.text: I have used it most days for a few months and it is the best compact I have ever had.
customer_reviews.author: Geoffrey Walker

customer_reviews.title: Very good service lovely as pictures
customer_reviews.text: Wonderful picture the zoom is fantastic even I can use it and I'm just the wife
customer_reviews.author: d m bayliss

customer_reviews.title: Great zoom. Good low light picture
customer_reviews.text: Still working well after a year of use. very robust. Great zoom. Good low light picture.
customer_reviews.author: R. Jarvis

product_meta.title: Panasonic LUMIX DMC-TZ70EB-K 30x70 Super Zoom Camera - Black
product_meta.description:
Size Name:Camera| Colour Name:BlackThe enhanced LUMIX TZ70 is the optimum camera for every destination. Every feature is built for the traveller in you. From architectural patterns to subtle colour gradations, the TZ70 lets you photograph with ease, under any light condition. Its compact size also makes it suitable for slipping into a pocket or a bag for easy access.

BOX CONTAINS
Battery Pack 
AC Adaptor 
USB Cable 
Hand Strap 
CD-ROM
feature_bullets: 12 Megapixel and 30x Optical Zoom Leica DC Vario-Elmar 24-720 mm Lens
Creative control with control ring, raw shooting, manual focus and focus peaking
Enhanced optical image stabilisation with five-axis correction and level shot function
50p AVCHD/MP4 Full HD video recording (12 MP, LEICA DC Vario Lens) 3 inch LCD

specifications.Delivery information:: We cannot deliver certain products outside mainland UK
